headline: FTC Sues Live Nation Over Ticket Resale Practices
summary: The lawsuit accuses Live Nation Entertainment and Ticketmaster of working with brokers to “harvest millions of dollars worth of tickets” and sell them to fans at “significantly” higher prices.

content.title: FTC Sues Live Nation Over Ticket Resale Practices
content.summary: The lawsuit accuses Live Nation Entertainment and Ticketmaster of working with brokers to “harvest millions of dollars worth of tickets” and sell them to fans at “significantly” higher prices.

headline: FTC Sues Ticketmaster Alleging Illegal Ticket Resale Tactics
summary: The Federal Trade Commission and seven states sued Ticketmaster and its parent company  Live Nation  alleging the ticketing giant engaged in illegal ticket resale tactics that cost consumers billions of dollars.  Ticketmaster coordinated with brokers to collect millions of dollars worth of tickets and then sell those tickets at a significant markup in the secondary market, according to the lawsuit filed Thursday.  The agency and states alleged Ticketmaster also advertised lower prices than consumers actually had to pay, deceptively claimed to have limits on the number of tickets consumers could buy and allowed brokers to sell tickets on its platform that they had obtained in excess of limits on purchases, the lawsuit said.

content.title: FTC Sues Ticketmaster Alleging Illegal Ticket Resale Tactics
content.summary: The Federal Trade Commission and seven states sued Ticketmaster and its parent company  Live Nation  alleging the ticketing giant engaged in illegal ticket resale tactics that cost consumers billions of dollars.  Ticketmaster coordinated with brokers to collect millions of dollars worth of tickets and then sell those tickets at a significant markup in the secondary market, according to the lawsuit filed Thursday.  The agency and states alleged Ticketmaster also advertised lower prices than consumers actually had to pay, deceptively claimed to have limits on the number of tickets consumers could buy and allowed brokers to sell tickets on its platform that they had obtained in excess of limits on purchases, the lawsuit said.

headline: Russell 2000 gains, Nvidia's Intel stake, FTC sues Live Nation
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including the Russell 2000's (^RUT) gains putting it on track for a record close on Thursday, the latest news around Nvidia's (NVDA) $5 billion investment in Intel (INTC), and the Federal Trade Commission's (FTC) antitrust lawsuit against event ticketing giant Live Nation Entertainment (LYV). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Cracker Barrel, Live Nation, chip stocks: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Cracker Barrel Old Country Store's (CBRL) stock reaction to its latest earnings results amid consumer backlash over its logo redesign, Live Nation Entertainment (LYV) and Ticketmaster facing an FTC (Federal Trade Commission) over automated ticketing bots, and chip stock moves responding to Nvidia (NVDA) taking a $5 billion stake in Intel (INTC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
